page.title: 05 The Gamekeeper (cont.)
page.content: Most shooters bring their own dogs to collect the dead birds,but some professional men bring trained dogs to collect the birds which the shooter's dogs have not found. Partridge shooting starts on the last Saturday of September and pheasant shooting on the 3rd week of November.The season ending on the 1st of February. The gamekeeper does not have any employed helpers but friends come at weekends and some evenings to help.He usually starts work at 6 a.m. and continues until 9.30 p.m.He rears Melanistic,Ring-Neck,Black-Neck and Chinese pheasants on the Ragley Estate and it costs about 10 pounds to get each bird into the air.A few poachers have been known on the Estate but not enough to reduce the amount of birds.
